page.title: 01INTRODUCING WHEATHAMPSTEAD
page.content: In our 3km by 4km block, Wheathampstead is the largest centre of population.Wheathampstead is midway between St. Albans and Harpenden.There are other different places around Wheathampstead such as Hatfield,Luton and Welwyn Garden City. Wheathampstead is a small village although a new housing estate has been built during the last few years.The river Lea runs through the village. In the village there is an old church called St. Helens.On the way to St. Albans there is a common called Nomansland Common.There is a fair which sometimes goes there.There are quite a lot of farms around the village such as Beech Hyde Farm,Marford Farm and Lamer Farm.There are three schools in the area, Beech Hyde, St. Helens and Wheathampstead School.There are shops and houses in the village.
